data.title: 15 of The Best Rodeo Movies You Will Love to Watch
data.meta_description: 15 of the best rodeo movies. Watch them again and again they are so good! If you love cowboys, cowgirls and the western lifestyle check out these great movies.
data.meta_site_name: Everything Country Living - Western Lifestyle Site
data.text:
Best rodeo movies introduction

This post will show you 15 of the best rodeo movies you should watch. Some of them are older but they are still really good. These movies are classics and many of the cowboys in them face struggles and overcome them which I find inspiring and motivational when I’m facing my own challenges.

I really enjoyed all these cowboy and rodeo movies and I hope you will too!

Rodeo movies have long captivated audiences with their thrilling portrayal of cowboy culture, the rodeo circuit, and the rugged spirit of the American West. Whether you’re a fan of intense bull riding, heartwarming love stories, or the timeless charm of a young cowboy’s journey, there’s a rodeo film for you. Here are the top 15 rodeo movies that bring the rodeo world to life on the big screen.

Most of these movies are available to watch on Amazon. I may earn a commission with Amazon Affiliate links. If you make a purchase through the links, at no extra cost to you.

15 of the Best Rodeo Movies

1. Junior Bonner (1972)

Starring the legendary Steve McQueen, Junior Bonner is a classic Sam Peckinpah film that delves into the life of a rodeo rider returning to his hometown. With a focus on family dynamics and the struggles of an aging cowboy, this film offers a poignant look at the rodeo lifestyle.

2. The Electric Horseman (1979)

In this film, Robert Redford plays a former rodeo star turned media spectacle who decides to free a valuable horse from exploitation. With Jane Fonda co-starring, this movie blends romance, adventure, and a strong message about animal rights.

3. 8 Seconds (1994)

Based on the life of Lane Frost, a legendary PRCA bull riding world champion, 8 Seconds stars Luke Perry in a touching portrayal of the young cowboy’s rise to fame and tragic end. It’s a must-watch for anyone interested in the world of professional bull riding. I have watched this movie many times my little sister had it on every day for a year! She would definitely say this is the best rodeo movie.

4. The Cowboy Way (1994)

Featuring Woody Harrelson and Kiefer Sutherland, this action-comedy follows two cowboys who travel from New Mexico to New York City searching for a missing friend. Their rodeo skills and cowboy charm help them navigate the big city’s challenges in this entertaining film. I love Woody Harrelson in this movie, and it made me a big fan of his after seeing this movie.

5. Pure Country (1992)

George Strait stars as Dusty Chandler, a country music star who returns to his roots to rediscover his love for music and rodeo. This film is a heartwarming tale of self-discovery and the importance of staying true to oneself.

6. The Longest Ride (2015)

Adapted from Nicholas Sparks’ novel, this film intertwines the love story of a young woman and a professional bull rider, played by Scott Eastwood, with the memories of an older couple. It’s a beautiful narrative about love, sacrifice, and following one’s passion.

7. Cowboy Up (2001)

Starring Kiefer Sutherland and Marcus Thomas, this film explores the dangerous and thrilling world of professional bull riding. The story of two brothers striving to make it big in the rodeo circuit is both gripping and emotional.

8. J.W. Coop (1972)

With Cliff Robertson as the film’s star and director, J.W. Coop tells the story of a rodeo cowboy trying to reclaim his place in the rodeo world after a decade in prison. It’s a raw and realistic portrayal of the challenges faced by returning rodeo stars. The plot is very interesting, and you will want to watch it more then once so get a copy of the dvd.

9. The Rider (2017)

Directed by Chloé Zhao, this critically acclaimed film follows Brady Blackburn, a young cowboy who must find a new purpose after a rodeo accident ends his riding days. The film is based on a true story and features non-professional actors, adding to its authenticity.

10. The Honkers (1972)

Starring James Coburn, this film offers a gritty look at the life of an aging rodeo star struggling with personal demons and the changing rodeo world. It’s a compelling exploration of the sacrifices made by those in the rodeo profession.

11. Walk. Ride. Rodeo. (2019)

Based on the true story of Amberley Snyder, a barrel racer who defied the odds after a car accident left her paralyzed, this film is an inspiring tale of resilience and determination. Amberley’s journey back to the rodeo circuit is both heartwarming and motivational.

12. When the Legends Die (1972) best rodeo movies

Featuring Frederic Forrest, this film follows the life of a young Native American boy who becomes a rodeo star under the guidance of a former champion, played by Richard Widmark. It’s a moving story about identity, heritage, and the struggles within the rodeo world.

13. Ruby Jean and Joe (1996)

Tom Selleck stars as Joe Wade, a former rodeo star who forms an unlikely friendship with Ruby Jean, a young woman with dreams of becoming a rodeo champion. Their journey together is filled with personal growth and mutual respect, making for a touching narrative.

14. Urban Cowboy (1980) – best rodeo movies

Starring John Travolta and Debra Winger, Urban Cowboy takes a look at the urban side of rodeo culture. Set in Houston, Texas, this film explores the life of Bud Davis, a young man from a small town who finds love and trouble at Gilley’s, a famous honky-tonk bar with a mechanical bull. It’s a fascinating blend of romance, drama, and the cowboy way of life in a city setting. This movie I have watched many times over I love the drama in this movie in the marriage and the 80’s is just a fun time in history. The cowboy outfits are really great and the dancing and music in this movie are memorable.

15. The Lusty Men (1952) – best rodeo movies

This classic film starring Robert Mitchum and Susan Hayward explores the high-stakes world of rodeo with intense drama and gripping performances.

Conclusion to the best rodeo movies

These films are good examples of how the rodeo world can be portrayed on the big screen, capturing the essence of cowboy culture, the excitement of rodeo events, and the personal stories of those who live for the rodeo. Whether you’re a longtime fan or new to the genre, these rodeo movies offer a wonderful glimpse into the heart and soul of the rodeo circuit.

I hope you enjoyed learning about the best rodeo movies! What is your favorite one on the list I would love to hear from you leave a comment below!
